meanings.definition: A straight line segment joining two points on a curve.
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully drew the chords to connect the dots on the graph.
meanings.sent2: The chords on the map helped us navigate the winding road.
meanings.sent3: The detective followed the chords of evidence to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The chords of fate brought them together in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The glowing chords on the screen highlighted the important data points.

meanings.definition: A group of three or more musical notes played together.
meanings.sent1: The musician strummed the chords on the guitar with skill.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful melody was created by harmonious chords.
meanings.sent3: The chords of the song resonated deeply with the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her voice intertwined with the piano chords like a dance.
meanings.sent5: The powerful chords filled the concert hall with emotion.

meanings.definition: A feeling of tension or strain.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with awkward chords after the argument.
meanings.sent2: The chords of anxiety tightened around her chest.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at humor only added more chords to the situation.
meanings.sent4: The chords of anticipation hummed in the air before the big reveal.
meanings.sent5: The chords of uncertainty played in her mind as she waited for the results.
